alert.note: Alert for Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 11 at 3:39PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Koyukuk River near Allakaket. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Moderate flooding is expected. Flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low lying roads in Allakaket will flood. Cabins in low lying areas could flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 322 PM AKDT, Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell over the headwaters of the Koyukuk and Alatna Rivers earlier this week. That water is now moving down the Koyukuk River. Water has not yet crested at Bettles, but is expected to later today. Minor flooding is occuring along the river in Allakaket, and the water is expect to rise several more feet at Allakaket through Monday which will flood some roads. The crest is expected to reach Allakaket Monday morning. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood People in Allakaket and Alatna should move valuables such as boats and vehicles away from the river and secure them on higher ground. People should prepare for low lying roads to become covered in water and impassable.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
